name: Mana Bloom
text:
Mana Bloom enters the battlefield with X charge counters on it.
Remove a charge counter from Mana Bloom: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Activate this ability only once each turn.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Mana Bloom has no charge counters on it, return it to its owner's hand.

name: Manabond
text: At the beginning of your end step, you may reveal your hand and put all land cards from it onto the battlefield. If you do, discard your hand.

name: Mana Breach
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player returns a land he or she controls to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: The mana that binds the world together can also tear it apart.
The wizard had it all—until she tried to use it.

name: Mana Cache
text:
At the beginning of each player's end step, put a charge counter on Mana Cache for each untapped land that player controls.
Remove a charge counter from Mana Cache: Add {C} to your mana pool. Any player may activate this ability but only during his or her turn before the end step.

name: Mana Chains
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "Cumulative upkeep {1}." (At the beginning of its controller's upkeep, that player puts an age counter on it, then sacrifices it unless he or she pays its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

editions.flavor:
"The Lord of the Wastes must be destroyed; I am bound to this destiny by the chains of fate. If only Gerrard would see his part."
—Sisay, journal

name: Mana-Charged Dragon
text:
Flying, trample
Join forces — Whenever Mana-Charged Dragon attacks or blocks, each player starting with you may pay any amount of mana. Mana-Charged Dragon gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the total amount of mana paid this way.

name: Mana Clash
text: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

name: Manacles of Decay
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack.
{B}: Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
{R}: Enchanted creature can't block this turn.

name: Mana Confluence
text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Five rivers encircle Theros, flowing with waters more ancient than the world itself.

name: Mana Crypt
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, Mana Crypt deals 3 damage to you.
{T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: An utterly silent chamber, submitted by an artificer who wished to remain anonymous.

name: Mana Cylix
text: {1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Those who dismiss the cylix as an ordinary wooden bowl are blind to the true measure of its worth.
Overflowing with visions of the possible future, it lends power to those in the present.

name: Mana Drain
text: Counter target spell. At the beginning of your next main phase, add an amount of {C} to your mana pool equal to that spell's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor:
"Power is wasted on the weak. They never keep it for long."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Mana Echoes
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, you may add an amount of {C} to your mana pool equal to the number of creatures you control that share a creature type with it.

editions.flavor: When the ground is saturated with mana, even the lightest footstep can bring it to the surface.

name: Mana Flair
text: Add {R} to your mana pool for each nonland permanent by the artist of your choice.

editions.flavor:
What began as black
Has slowly shifted to red.
Fickle color pie.

name: Mana Flare
text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.

name: Manaforce Mace
text:
Domain — Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control.
Equip {3}

editions.flavor: As the shards merged, relics once thought mundane regained forgotten powers.

name: Manaforge Cinder
text: {1}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Activate this ability no more than three times each turn.

editions.flavor: Cinder mystics set traps for sluaghs and other spirits of flame, seeking to extract the secrets of the fire their own hearts have lost.

name: Mana Geyser
text: Add {R} to your mana pool for each tapped land your opponents control.

editions.flavor: The Quicksilver Sea hissed and bubbled at the indignity. The Vulshok shaman just smiled.
The Quicksilver Sea hissed and bubbled at the indignity. The Vulshok shaman just smiled.

name: Managorger Hydra
text:
Trample
Whenever a player casts a spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Managorger Hydra.

name: Manakin
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Hanna regarded Squee sternly. "Because it's not a toy, no matter how much it may look like one," she said, taking the manakin from him.

name: Mana Leak
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

editions.flavor: The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.

"The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy."
—Volrath
The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.

"The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy."
—Volrath

"If a man will begin with certainties, he shall end in doubts."
—Sir Francis Bacon, The Advancement of Learning
The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.
The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.
The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.
The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.

"The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy."
—Volrath

name: Mana Leech
text:
You may choose not to untap Mana Leech during your untap step.
{T}: Tap target land. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Mana Leech remains tapped.

name: Manalith
text: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Planeswalkers seek out great monuments throughout the Multiverse, knowing that their builders were unknowingly drawn by the convergence of mana in the area.

name: Mana Matrix
text: Instant and enchantment spells you cast cost up to {2} less to cast.

name: Mana Maze
text: Players can't cast spells that share a color with the spell most recently cast this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Those who know only one path to victory can never hope to triumph."
—The Blind Seer

name: Manamorphose
text:
Add two mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: For a moment, objects of pure mana glimmered in the wonderstruck boggart's hands. In the next moment, they were in his mouth, as he chewed contentedly.

"Master the chaotic forces of nature, and you shall master magic."
—Yare-Tiva, warden of Gramur forest

name: Manaplasm
text: Whenever you cast a spell, Manaplasm gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor: Urak froze when he heard it. That was his first mistake. He turned and cast a dramatic ward spell. That was his last.
Urak froze when he heard it. That was his first mistake. He turned and cast a dramatic ward spell. That was his last.

name: Mana Prism
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

name: Mana Reflection
text: If you tap a permanent for mana, it produces twice as much of that mana instead.

editions.flavor: Despite its darkness, Shadowmoor doesn't want for growth. Legions of creeping things thrive in the shade.

name: Mana Screw
text: {1}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, add {2} to your mana pool. Play this ability only any time you could play an instant.

editions.flavor: There was no darker or more evil creation in all the multiverse than that of the mana screw.

name: Mana Seism
text: Sacrifice any number of lands, then add that much {C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"It is the nature of humanity not to worry about tomorrow, especially when there's a good chance they won't live to see the end of today."
—Kiku, Night's Flower

name: Mana Severance
text: Search your library for any number of land cards and exile them. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"And when this land is wasted, where will we go?"
—Thalakos lament

name: Mana Short
text: Tap all lands target player controls and empty his or her mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"Remove their power, and their will to fight will follow."
—Tolarian wizard

name: Mana Skimmer
text:
Flying
Whenever Mana Skimmer deals damage to a player, tap target land that player controls. That land doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

editions.flavor: They traverse the mana-starved wastes in search of richer lands.

name: Mana Tithe
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

editions.flavor:
"Those who seek to upset the balance must be taxed for such ambitions."
—Verithain, mesa high priest

name: Mana Vapors
text: Lands target player controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.

editions.flavor: The scent of magic can rob you of your senses, blinding you to the world.

name: Mana Vault
text:
Mana Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap Mana Vault.
At the beginning of your draw step, if Mana Vault is tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add {C}{C}{C} to your mana pool.

name: Mana Vortex
text:
When you cast Mana Vortex, counter it unless you sacrifice a land.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a land.
When there are no lands on the battlefield, sacrifice Mana Vortex.

name: Mana Web
text: Whenever a land an opponent controls is tapped for mana, tap all lands that player controls that could produce any type of mana that land could produce.

name: Manaweft Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

editions.flavor:
"I see in their interconnectedness a strange embodiment of the natural order."
—Dionus, elvish archdruid

name: Mangara of Corondor
text: {T}: Exile Mangara of Corondor and target permanent.

editions.flavor: "I have been brought to this place and I cannot leave. I may be free of the amber, but I am still in prison."

name: Mangara's Blessing
text:
You gain 5 life.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Mangara's Blessing, you gain 2 life, and you return Mangara's Blessing from your graveyard to your hand at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Mangara's Equity
text:
As Mangara's Equity enters the battlefield, choose black or red.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Mangara's Equity unless you pay {1}{W}.
Whenever a creature of the chosen color deals damage to you or a white creature you control, Mangara's Equity deals that much damage to that creature.

name: Mangara's Tome
text:
When Mangara's Tome enters the battlefield, search your library for five cards, exile them in a face-down pile, and shuffle that pile. Then shuffle your library.
{2}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead put the top card of the exiled pile into its owner's hand.

name: Maniacal Rage
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.

editions.flavor: The spikes of sangrite made the goblin stronger, but they didn't make him any smarter.
Only by sacrificing any semblance of defense could Gerrard best Greven.
"Remember me?" Tahngarth roared. "Now I'll repay you for my stay on Rath"
Only by sacrificing any semblance of defense could Gerrard best Greven.
Only by sacrificing any semblance of defense could Gerrard best Greven.

name: Manic Scribe
text:
When Manic Scribe enters the battlefield, each opponent puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Delirium — At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, that player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

name: Manic Vandal
text: When Manic Vandal enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.

editions.flavor: It's fun. He doesn't need another reason.
It's fun. He doesn't need another reason.

name: Manifold Insights
text: Reveal the top ten cards of your library. Starting with the next opponent in turn order, each opponent chooses a different nonland card from among them. Put the chosen cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

name: Manipulate Fate
text:
Search your library for three cards, exile them, then shuffle your library.
Draw a card.

name: Mannichi, the Fevered Dream
text: {1}{R}: Switch each creature's power and toughness until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Early in his reign, Konda fell ill. His head burned with fever, and he saw visions of his future. In them, he saw a spirit-child, and, in that child's eyes, a way to make his empire last forever."
—The History of Kamigawa

name: Man of Measure
text:
As long as you're shorter than an opponent, Man of Measure has first strike and gets +0/+1.
As long as you're taller than an opponent, Man of Measure gets +1/+0.

editions.flavor: You need to be this tall to play this card.

name: Manor Gargoyle
text:
Defender
Manor Gargoyle has indestructible as long as it has defender.
{1}: Until end of turn, Manor Gargoyle loses defender and gains flying.

editions.flavor: Nothing could break it but the fall.

name: Manor Skeleton
text:
Haste
{1}{B}: Regenerate Manor Skeleton.

editions.flavor: Lungs dried to parchment wheeze blasphemies within a cage of bleached bone.

name: Man-o'-War
text: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Jace vs. Chandra
editions.flavor:
"Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

"Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

name: Manriki-Gusari
text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+2 and has "{T}: Destroy target Equipment."
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Manta Ray
text:
Manta Ray can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
Manta Ray can't be blocked except by blue creatures.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Manta Ray.

name: Manta Riders
text: {U}: Manta Riders gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Water is firmament to the finned."
—Oracle en-Vec

"Water is firmament to the finned."
—Oracle en-Vec

name: Mantis Engine
text:
{2}: Mantis Engine gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{2}: Mantis Engine gains first strike until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

editions.flavor: Tawnos left a legacy of animal designs in many of Urza's creations.

"It's a clever design. You should look closely at its gearing after it swallows your head."
—Jhoira, master artificer

name: Mantis Rider
text: Flying, vigilance, haste

editions.flavor: Mantis riders know their mounts owe them no allegiance. Even a mantis ridden for years would consume a rider who loses focus for only a moment.

name: Mantle of Leadership
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, enchanted creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

name: Mantle of Webs
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor: "Why does everything the Golgari touch end up sticky?"—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

name: Map the Wastes
text: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library. Bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

name: Maralen of the Mornsong
text:
Players can't draw cards.
At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player loses 3 life, searches his or her library for a card, puts it into his or her hand, then shuffles his or her library.

editions.flavor: Maralen sent Veesa, Endry, and Iliona—the Vendilion clique—on the gravest of tasks.

name: Maralen of the Mornsong Avatar
text:
At the beginning of the game, you may pay any amount of life.
You can't draw cards.
At the beginning of your draw step, look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the amount of life paid with Maralen of the Mornsong Avatar. Put one of them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: MOR Prize Avatar

name: Marang River Prowler
text:
Marang River Prowler can't block and can't be blocked.
You may cast Marang River Prowler from your graveyard as long as you control a black or green permanent.

editions.flavor: The currents of the Marang wash away both tracks and blood.

name: Marang River Skeleton
text:
{B}: Regenerate Marang River Skeleton.
Megamorph {3}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: The gurgling of the Marang conceals both footsteps and screams.

name: Marath, Will of the Wild
text:
Marath, Will of the Wild enters the battlefield with a number of +1/+1 counters on it equal to the amount of mana spent to cast it.
{X}, Remove X +1/+1 counters from Marath: Choose one —
• Put X +1/+1 counters on target creature. X can't be 0.
• Marath deals X damage to target creature or player. X can't be 0.
• Create an X/X green Elemental creature token. X can't be 0.

name: Marauding Knight
text:
Protection from white
Marauding Knight gets +1/+1 for each Plains your opponents control.

editions.flavor:
"They ride our trails as if they were designed to," said the guard.
"They were," replied Gerrard.

name: Marauding Maulhorn
text: Marauding Maulhorn attacks each combat if able unless you control a creature named Advocate of the Beast.

editions.flavor:
"It's not just you. Everyone makes it angry."
—Ardenoth, elvish nature advocate

name: Maraxus
text: Creatures you control get +1/+0.

editions.flavor: Too chaotic for even the other warlords of Keld, Maraxus has devoted himself to serving as a hired killer for the sinister Volrath. A man fond of his work, he's more than willing to put in those extra hours needed to perfect his craft.

name: Maraxus of Keld
text: Maraxus of Keld's power and toughness are each equal to the number of untapped artifacts, creatures, and lands you control.

editions.flavor:
"I have no master. I am chaos."
—Maraxus of Keld

name: Marble Chalice
text: {T}: You gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: The cup was a gift from the sphinx Tameron, who hoped that those who drank from it would live long enough to decrypt the sphinxes' wisdom.

name: Marble Diamond
text:
Marble Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic

name: Marble Priest
text:
All Walls able to block Marble Priest do so.
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to Marble Priest by Walls.

name: Marble Titan
text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

editions.flavor: It entered the temple with all the pomp and decorum of a rock hitting a goblin's skull.

"Strapping on nine hundred pounds of armor every morning would make any warrior cross."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Marchesa's Decree
text:
When Marchesa's Decree enters the battlefield, you become the monarch.
Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, that creature's controller loses 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"Those who seize power must have the means to hold it."
—Queen Marchesa

name: Marchesa's Emissary
text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: "The Black Rose doesn't tolerate weeds."

name: Marchesa's Infiltrator
text:
Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Whenever Marchesa's Infiltrator deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.

editions.flavor: "Secrets, like coins, are easy to steal."

name: Marchesa's Smuggler
text:
Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
{1}{U}{R}: Target creature you control gains haste until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor: "Watch your head . . . and your back."

name: Marchesa, the Black Rose
text:
Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Other creatures you control have dethrone.
Whenever a creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step.

name: March from the Tomb
text: Return any number of target Ally creature cards with total converted mana cost 8 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor: They came from all walks of life, from every part of Zendikar, and they returned with one unifying cause.
They came from all walks of life, from every part of Zendikar, and they returned with one unifying cause.

name: March of Souls
text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated. For each creature destroyed this way, its controller creates a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

name: March of the Machines
text: Each noncreature artifact is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. (Equipment that's a creature can't equip a creature.)

name: March of the Returned
text: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: The Returned have no memory of the Underworld or of their former lives. The golden masks they wear are the last gifts of the selves they left behind.

name: Mardu Ascendancy
text:
Whenever a nontoken creature you control attacks, create a 1/1 red Goblin creature token that's tapped and attacking.
Sacrifice Mardu Ascendancy: Creatures you control get +0/+3 until end of turn.

name: Mardu Banner
text:
{T}: Add {R}, {W}, or {B} to your mana pool.
{R}{W}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice Mardu Banner: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Speed to strike, fury to smash.

name: Mardu Blazebringer
text: When Mardu Blazebringer attacks or blocks, sacrifice it at end of combat.

editions.flavor:
"Make sure he's pointed in the right direction before you light him. And don't let the goblins anywhere near the torch."
—Kerai Suddenblade, Mardu hordechief

name: Mardu Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Mardu Charm deals 4 damage to target creature.
• Create two 1/1 white Warrior creature tokens. They gain first strike until end of turn.
• Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

name: Mardu Hateblade
text: {B}: Mardu Hateblade gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

editions.flavor: "There may be little honor in my tactics, but there is no honor in losing."

name: Mardu Heart-Piercer
text: Raid — When Mardu Heart-Piercer enters the battlefield, if you attacked with a creature this turn, Mardu Heart-Piercer deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: "Those who have never ridden before the wind do not know the true joy of war."
"Those who have never ridden before the wind do not know the true joy of war."

name: Mardu Hordechief
text: Raid — When Mardu Hordechief enters the battlefield, if you attacked with a creature this turn, create a 1/1 white Warrior creature token.

editions.flavor: The horde grows with each assault.

name: Mardu Roughrider
text: Whenever Mardu Roughrider attacks, target creature can't block this turn.

editions.flavor: The most ferocious saddlebrutes lead the assault, ramming through massed pikes and stout barricades as if they were paper and silk.

name: Mardu Runemark
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
Enchanted creature has first strike as long as you control a white or black permanent.

name: Mardu Scout
text: Dash {1}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

editions.flavor: The Mardu all enjoy war, but only the goblins make a game of it.

name: Mardu Shadowspear
text:
Whenever Mardu Shadowspear attacks, each opponent loses 1 life.
Dash {1}{B} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

name: Mardu Skullhunter
text:
Mardu Skullhunter enters the battlefield tapped.
Raid — When Mardu Skullhunter enters the battlefield, if you attacked with a creature this turn, target opponent discards a card.

name: Mardu Strike Leader
text:
Whenever Mardu Strike Leader attacks, create a 2/1 black Warrior creature token.
Dash {3}{B} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

name: Mardu Warshrieker
text: Raid — When Mardu Warshrieker enters the battlefield, if you attacked with a creature this turn, add {R}{W}{B} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"No body can contain so much fury. It reminds me of another battle, long past."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Mardu Woe-Reaper
text: Whenever Mardu Woe-Reaper or another Warrior enters the battlefield under your control, you may exile target creature card from a graveyard. If you do, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: "Those who died in battle deserve their rest."

name: Marhault Elsdragon
text: Rampage 1 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)

editions.flavor: Marhault Elsdragon follows a strict philosophy, never letting emotions cloud his thoughts. No chance observer could imagine the rage in his heart.
Marhault Elsdragon follows a strict philosophy, never letting emotions cloud his thoughts. No chance observer could imagine the rage in his heart.
Marhault follows a strict philosophy, never letting emotions cloud his thoughts. No chance observer could imagine the rage in his heart.
